docs.title: Godot Material Icons
docs.text:
Addon for easy using Material Icons in Godot UI

Project uses Templarian's Material-Design-Icons is a collection of icons for the Material Design specification.

  • MaterialButton: A node that displays an Material Icon as a button.

docs.title: Icon Finder Tutorial
docs.text:
First add one of this nodes:

  • MaterialIcon
  • MaterialButton

Open Icon Finder, go to Godot's menu Project (1) > Tools (2) > Icon Finder (3) So you can find the icons easily.

You can search (1) icons and change preview size (2), and click on icon you want to use. Button with ❔ opens this online docs.

When you click on icon you want to use it alias will be copy to system clipboard.

Now select Icon node in scene tree.

Look at node Inspector, paste icon alias using (Ctrl + V or Right Mouse Button > Paste) as Icon Name (1) and set it size (2).

Now icons are in your scene:

docs.title: Using Material Icons in RichTextLabel
docs.text:
Example code of using emojis in RichTextLabel (included in addon: res://addons/material-design-icons/examples/LabelWithIcons.gd): 

@tool
extends RichTextLabel

@export_multiline
var text_with_icons : String:
    set(value):
        text_with_icons = value
        bbcode_enabled = true
        text = MaterialIconsDB.parse_icons(value)

    get: return text_with_icons

func _ready():
    bbcode_enabled = true
    text = MaterialIconsDB.parse_icons(text_with_icons)

This is the result of the above code, with text_with_icons = "Label with icons [icon:image-outline]"
